title: FireShield 2kg ABC Dry Powder & 1.0m x 1.0m Hard Case Fire Blanket
features: Tackles flammable solids, liquids and gases
description: Product Description Home Safety Pack FireShield Dry Powder Fire Extinguisher & 1m x 1m Soft Case Fire Blanket This fire safety package is perfect for safeguarding personal spaces such as homes, flats, bed-sits, apartments, or vacation rentals. Carefully crafted from our renowned FireShield fire extinguisher series, this package is tailored to provide reliable and top-notch protection. FireShield extinguishers are highly regarded for their exceptional quality and durability, making them a trusted choice for fire safety needs. Features Kitemarked to BS EN3 Complete with Bracket & Centre Strap Corrosion Resistant Finish Fire Ratings: A, B & C FireShield Double Dry Powder Fire Extinguisher & Fire Blanket Pack… Home Fire Safety Pack FireShield Work From Home Fire Safety Bundle Home/Landlord Fire Safety Pack Add To Basket Add To Basket Add To Basket Add To Basket Customer Reviews 4.1 out of 5 stars 5 4.7 out of 5 stars 901 4.5 out of 5 stars 2 4.5 out of 5 stars 151 Price £57.50 £ 57 . 50 £29.99 £ 29 . 99 £47.50 £ 47 . 50 £38.05 £ 38 . 05 Fire Ratings 13A 70B C 8A 34B C 8A 34B C 13A 70B C Extinguishing medium ABC 40 ABC 40 ABC 40 ABC 40 Temperature range -20°C - +60°C -20°C - +60°C -20°C - +60°C -20°C - +60°C Material Steel Steel Steel Steel Height 385mm 337mm 337mm 385mm Width including hose 128mm 115mm 115mm 128mm Diameter 120mm 100mm 100mm 120mm Frequently Asked Questions What classification of fire should a ABC fire extinguisher be used on? ABC dry powder fire extinguishers can be used on Class A solid combustibles, Class B flammable liquids, Class C flammable gases and electrical fires. What colour is an ABC fire extinguisher? The canister has a red body, a blue banner running along the top section labelling it POWDER, and a horn-shaped nozzle. White capitalised text is used for the POWDER label. Businesses who would use an ABC dry powder fire extinguisher ABC dry powder fire extinguishers are commonly found in fabrication industries, industrial units, outside events, garage forecourts, businesses with large boiler rooms, LPG dispensing plants, welding or flame cutting businesses. Do your extinguishers come fully serviced and ready to use on delivery? All our portable fire extinguishers are supplied ready for use, but those with larger capacities may need to be filled and charged prior to the first time they’re used. The product listing will explain this clearly.
